original: Holmdal, Bror Johan Erik, arkitekt SAR, Flöda, f. 19/1/85 i Gbg av apot. Karl Oskar H. o. Alfrida Jansson. G. 21 m. Agnes Övregaard. — Mog:ex. 05, utex. fr. CTH 09, Konsthögsk. 13, stud .-resor t. Danm. o. Tyskl. 07, Finl. o. Ryssl. 11, 12 o. 13, Norge 18, Danm., Belg. o. Frankr. 20, Tyskl, Österr. o. Ital 21-22, Tyskl. o. Tjeckoslov. 28, Danm. 33 m. fl. Anst. h. arkit. F. Lidvall i S:t Petersburg 11, prof. S. Curman 12, arkit. Höög o. Morsing i Sthlm 13-14, prof. I. Tengbom ibid. 14-16, arkit. S. Cronstedt ibid. 16, rit-kont :ch. o. kontrollant v. Centralbanken f. Norges nybyggn. i Oslo 16-21, anst. v. arkit :kont. f. jub :utställn. i Gbg 22-23, tj .-gjort som vik. stadsar-kit. o. byggn |kontrollant i byggn :ndn i Gbg, byggn :kontr. i Flöda 43-46, egen arkit :rör. i Gbg sed. 23’. Hair utf. ritn. t. en mångfald hyreshus, ind:-byggn. o. komm. byggn. som komm:-hus, skolor, församhhus, barnhem, ål-derd .-hem, kyrkor, kapell m. m. samt ett stort antal inredn. t. bl. a. Gbgssy-stemet, banker, bufféer, danslokaler, herrgiårdiar m. m. Medl. av SAR, Tekn. samf. i Gbg, Byggnitekn. samf. i Gbg o. Chalm. ingifören. Sekr. i styr. f. Barn. Dag i Gbg 28-29. Sami. av blanka vapen.
translated: Holmdal, Bror Johan Erik, architect SAR, Flöda, born on January 19, 1885 in Gothenburg to pharmacist Karl Oskar H. and Alfrida Jansson. Married on 1921 to Agnes Övregaard. Completed secondary education in 1905, graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1909, and from the Royal Institute of Art in 1913. Undertook study trips to Denmark and Germany in 1907, Finland and Russia in 1911, 1912, and 1913, Norway in 1918, Denmark, Belgium, and France in 1920, Germany, Austria, and Italy in 1921-1922, Germany and Czechoslovakia in 1928, and Denmark in 1933, among others. Employed at architect F. Lidvall in St. Petersburg in 1911, as a professor's assistant to S. Curman in 1912, with Höög and Morsing in Stockholm from 1913-1914, as a professor's assistant to I. Tengbom in 1914-1916, and with S. Cronstedt in 1916. Worked as a draftsman and supervisor at the building committee for the construction of the Central Bank of Norway in Oslo from 1916-1921, employed at the architect's office for the Jubilee Exhibition in Gothenburg from 1922-1923, and served as a substitute city architect and building inspector in the building committee in Gothenburg and building contractor in Flöda from 1943-1946. Established own architectural practice in Gothenburg since 1923. Designed plans for a variety of rental houses, industrial buildings, and municipal buildings such as city halls, schools, parish houses, orphanages, nursing homes, churches, chapels, and more, as well as numerous interiors for, among others, the Gothenburg System, banks, buffets, dance halls, manors, and more. Member of SAR, the Technical Society in Gothenburg, the Building Technology Society in Gothenburg, and the Chalmers Engineers Association. Secretary on the board of the Children's Day in Gothenburg in 1928-1929. Collector of firearms.

structured.name: Bror Johan Erik Holmdal
structured.description: Swedish architect, known for designing rental houses, industrial buildings, and municipal buildings such as city halls, schools, parish houses, orphanages, nursing homes, churches, chapels, and more. Established own architectural practice in Gothenburg since 1923. Secretary on the board of the Children's Day in Gothenburg in 1928-1929. Collector of firearms.
